characters.name: Rarity
characters.description: See Rarity.

characters.name: Bluenote
characters.description: Appears in The Fault in Our Cutie Marks playing a saxophone. Also appears in The Last Crusade. Has a similar color scheme to S05E16 Unnamed Earth Filly #2. Designed by Charmaine Verhagen. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. His cutie mark is a whole note and flat symbol on top of a blue and purple stylized "Jazz" pattern.

characters.name: Bracer Britches
characters.description: Appears in Fake It 'Til You Make It as a customer at Rarity For You. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as a boss during the "Fake It 'Til You Make It" boss battle event. His bio sttes, "This dapper Saddle Row regular takes thread count VERY seriously. Anything under 1,000, and he'll be one testy stallion." His cutie mark is a piece of fabric and pair of scissors. Voiced by Ian Hanlin.

characters.name: Chancellor Neighsay
characters.description: See Chancellor Neighsay.

characters.name: Cinnamon Chai
characters.description: The owner of a tea and cake shop in Canterlot in Rarity Investigates! Also mentioned in Beyond Equestria: Fluttershy Balances the Scales. Her cutie mark is a bowl of cake batter. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Nicole Oliver.

characters.name: Claude
characters.description: See Claude.

characters.name: Clear Sky
characters.description: See Clear Sky and Wind Sprint.

characters.name: Coriander Cumin
characters.description: See Coriander Cumin and Saffron Masala.

characters.name: Dandy Grandeur
characters.description: Appears in Fluttershy Leans In as an expert interior designer. Shares his body type and eye color with "Turner McColt", "Snow Hope", S08E19 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and BGE Unnamed Earth Stallion #2 and his body type with Cheese Sandwich, "Mules Grassfield", and Mudbriar. His cutie mark is a purple top hat and orange star. Voiced by Mackenzie Gray. Also mentioned as "Daddy Grandeur" on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #54 page 2 and appears in Beyond Equestria: Pinkie Pie Steps Up. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss with a story role during the "Rarity's Retro Revolution" event.

characters.name: Doctor Horse
characters.description: See Doctor Horse.

characters.name: Fancy Pants
characters.description: See Fancy Pants.

characters.name: Fashion Plate
characters.description: An editor for Cosmare magazine in Canterlot Boutique. Also appears in Spice Up Your Life and My Little Pony The Movie. His cutie mark is three yellow stars. Voiced by Peter Kelamis. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "As the editor of a famous fashion magazine, Fashion Plate is living the dream!"

characters.name: Fire Flare
characters.description: The leader of the Flaming Sky Firework Troupe in The Summer Sun Setback. Her cutie mark is a dark red flame with a yellow star in the center. Voiced by Kira Tozer.

characters.name: Firelight
characters.description: See Firelight.

characters.name: First Folio
characters.description: A librarian in the overdue returns office of the Canterlot Library in The Point of No Return. Her cutie mark is a quill pen and inkwell. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Flam
characters.description: See Flim and Flam.

characters.name: Fleur de Lis
characters.description: See Fleur de Lis.

characters.name: Flim
characters.description: See Flim and Flam.

characters.name: Hoo'Far
characters.description: A Saddle Arabian unicorn that appears in Road to Friendship as a frequent attendee of Trixie's magic show. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. His bio states, "Trixie's biggest Saddle Arabian fan--plus, he has a REALLY spacious caravan. What's not to like?" Voiced by Tariq Leslie.

characters.name: Hoofdini
characters.description: A famous pony magician and Trixie's idol in No Second Prances; shown in color on the French Intégrale de la saison 6 Region 2 DVD set cover. His cutie mark is a padlock and key.

characters.name: Jack Pot
characters.description: See Trixie's family.

characters.name: Jet Set
characters.description: See Jet Set and Upper Crust.

characters.name: Joe
characters.description: See Joe.

characters.name: Lily Lace
characters.description: See Couture du Future contestants.

characters.name: Luster Dawn
characters.description: See Luster Dawn.

characters.name: Merry
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Shares her depiction with Rarity. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Yes, DEFINITELY 'Merry' and not 'Rarity.' Are you sure that you’re not finding it hard to see?"

characters.name: Mistmane
characters.description: See Mistmane.

characters.name: Moon Dancer
characters.description: See Moon Dancer.

characters.name: Party Favor
characters.description: See Party Favor.

characters.name: Prince Blueblood
characters.description: See Prince Blueblood.

characters.name: Professor Flintheart
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Also appears in a photograph in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 7. Shares his body design with S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1 and S09E26 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1; somewhat similar to Micro 08 Unnamed Stallion - Severus Snape. Voiced by William Samples. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of him states, "'Work hard, learn hard, and use your skills' -- by which this pony means grueling magical drills..." Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria #61 R lists his name with a trademark symbol and quotes, "That's ten demerits, Miss Frost, for practicing frivolity in my classroom rather than perfecting your potions."

characters.name: Unicorn royal guards
characters.description: See royal guards.

characters.name: Sable Spirit
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as the empress of Mistmane's home village. Her cutie mark is a ceremonial feathered mask. Voiced by Elysia Rotaru. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "She may once have ruled Mistmane's homeland with an iron hoof, but this ancient empress eventually overcame her jealousy and changed for the better."

characters.name: Saffron Masala
characters.description: See Coriander Cumin and Saffron Masala.

characters.name: Sassy Saddles
characters.description: See Sassy Saddles.

characters.name: Shining Armor
characters.description: See Shining Armor.

characters.name: Snowfall Frost
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Also indirectly mentioned in A Trivial Pursuit. Shares her depiction with Starlight Glimmer. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "She wanted to wipe out a whole holiday -- ’til some spirits showed her a far better way."

characters.name: King Sombra
characters.description: See King Sombra.

characters.name: Star Swirl the Bearded
characters.description: See Star Swirl the Bearded.

characters.name: Starlight Glimmer
characters.description: See Starlight Glimmer.

characters.name: Stellar Flare
characters.description: See Sunburst's family.

characters.name: Stygian
characters.description: See Stygian.

characters.name: Sugar Belle
characters.description: See Sugar Belle.

characters.name: Sunburst
characters.description: See Sunburst.

characters.name: Sunset Shimmer
characters.description: See Sunset Shimmer.

characters.name: Tempest Shadow
characters.description: See Tempest Shadow.

characters.name: Trenderhoof
characters.description: See Trenderhoof.

characters.name: The Great and Powerful Trixie
characters.description: See Trixie.

characters.name: Twilight Sparkle
characters.description: See Twilight Sparkle (Sci-Twi).

characters.name: Upper Crust
characters.description: See Jet Set and Upper Crust.

characters.name: Zesty Gourmand
characters.description: See Zesty Gourmand.

characters.name:
Twilight's dad
Night Light
characters.description: See Twilight Velvet and Night Light.

characters.name:
Twilight's mom
Twilight Velvet
characters.description: See Twilight Velvet and Night Light.

characters.name:
Rarity's mom
Cookie Crumbles
characters.description: See Hondo Flanks and Cookie Crumbles.

characters.name:
Rarity's dad
Hondo Flanks
characters.description: See Hondo Flanks and Cookie Crumbles.

characters.name: Acrylic Paint
characters.description: A paint vendor featured during the song Pinkie the Party Planner in Pinkie Pride, voiced by Brian Drummond. Also appears in On Your Marks and Spice Up Your Life. His cutie mark is a paintbrush coated in blue paint.

characters.name: Aloha
characters.description: Appears in Buckball Season trying out for the Ponyville buckball team. Her cutie mark appears to be a Hawaiian shirt. Shares her design and eye color with "Juno".

characters.name:
Excitable Villager
Amethyst Skim
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, To Where and Back Again - Part 1, To Where and Back Again - Part 2, Rock Solid Friendship, Hard to Say Anything, and Enterplay collectible card game Equestrian Odysseys expansion set card #179 C. Shares one of her mane styles with "Millie" and S06E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1 and her cutie unmarked color scheme with S05E01 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #3. Her cutie mark is a milk carton. She is a character called "Excitable Villager" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Amethyst Star
characters.description: See Amethyst Star.

characters.name: Apple Polish
characters.description: One of the judges at Twilight Sparkle's School for Gifted Unicorns entrance exam in The Cutie Mark Chronicles. Later appears in Equestria Games, The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1, Parental Glideance, The Washouts, and Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 3. Her cutie mark is a red apple.

characters.name: Apple Stars
characters.description: See Apple Stars.

characters.name: Arpeggio
characters.description: One of the judges at Twilight Sparkle's School for Gifted Unicorns entrance exam in The Cutie Mark Chronicles. Later appears in Equestria Games and The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1. Also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 3. Has a color scheme similar to Octavia Melody's. His cutie mark is a pair of reversed joined quavers (music notes).

characters.name: Bacon Braids
characters.description: Appears, cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1,The Cutie Map - Part 2, and Rock Solid Friendship.

characters.name: Bags Valet
characters.description: A bellhop in Sweet and Elite. Shares Snails' character design. Seen carrying Rarity's bags at her suite in the castle. He is voiced by Peter New. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game Canterlot Nights expansion set card #27 C, which identifies him as a stallion indirectly and gives him the description "The sight of Rarity can be terrifying for any bellhop, especially for Bags Valet. (If only Rarity had one less marvelous chapeau...)"

characters.name: Ballad
characters.description: Appears in Lesson Zero trying to get Smarty Pants, in Bloom & Gloom running from the twittermite swarm, and in The Big Mac Question running from living apples. Shares her design with Holly Dash, shares her mane and tail style with Rainbow Dash, Daring Do, Skywishes, Sugar Grape, Lucky Dreams, Sweetsong, Breezie, Feathermay, "Doseydotes", Periwinkle, Star Dasher, Léon, Roku-chan, and sometimes Ploomette and Banana Bliss, shares her mane style with Andrea, shares her tail style with "Sunstone" and WCE Unnamed Mare - Jouster, shares most of her color scheme with Cloud Kicker and "Cloudy Kicks", and resembles "Lilac Notes". Her cutie mark is a lyre.

characters.name: Banana Fluff
characters.description: See Banana Fluff.

characters.name: Beyond
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her mane style and outfit design with Eclair Crème and S04E19 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, and shares her color scheme with "Infinity". Resembles the character Rosalind Lutece from the video game BioShock Infinite.

characters.name:
Spa Worker
Birch Bucket
characters.description: Appears in Applejack's "Day" Off as a spa pony at the Ponyville Day Spa. His cutie mark is a bowl pouring water. Voiced by Jason Simpson.

characters.name: Bittersweet
characters.description: See Bittersweet and Leadwing.

characters.name: Black Marble
characters.description: He appears in The Best Night Ever. He has the same coat and eye colors and accessories as Shooting Star and the same mane as Cherry Fizzy.

characters.name: Blossom Delight
characters.description: Appears in The One Where Pinkie Pie Knows. Shares her design with Trixie, "Pixie", and "Nixie". Her cutie mark is a yellow flower, the same as the accessory worn by "Drizzle".

characters.name: Blue Belle
characters.description: Appears at the Gala in The Best Night Ever. Shares same design as Amethyst Star, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem.

characters.name: Blue Moon
characters.description: See Blue Moon and North Star.

characters.name: Blueberry Frosting
characters.description: Appears, cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1 and The Cutie Map - Part 2.

characters.name: Brass Blare
characters.description: Appears once during the Summer Harvest Parade in One Bad Apple and twice at once during A True, True Friend in Magical Mystery Cure, in all three instances wearing a shako and playing a trumpet. Has the same coat and mane colors as Rare Find and the same tail design as Dr. Hooves, Meadow Song, "Eiffel", and Lucky Clover. His cutie mark is an F-clef.

characters.name: Bright Bulb
characters.description: Appears in Magic Duel and with the design, cutie mark, and hat of Dr. Hooves in Appleoosa's Most Wanted, Buckball Season, and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Has the same design as "Written Script", Comet Tail, and Rare Find. His cutie mark is an incandescent light bulb. He is named on his Enterplay collectible card game card α #53 R, which lists the quote "Okay, so here's the plan: we'll all rush in from every direction at once, and whammo! What could possibly go wrong?"

characters.name: Burning Heart
characters.description: See Sailor Moon ponies.

characters.name: Carbon Fizz
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident of Sire's Hollow.

characters.name:
Laid-Back Fan
Carrot Bun
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction managing a snack bar at the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus. A human version appears in X Marks the Spot. Her cutie mark is a carrot dog. She is a character called "Laid-Back Fan" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Posh Pony
Cayenne
characters.description: See Canterlot Trendsetters.

characters.name: Charm
characters.description: See Charm.

characters.name: Cherry Spices
characters.description: See Cherry Spices.

characters.name: Chocolate Sun
characters.description: Appears throughout the Grand Galloping Gala at Canterlot in The Best Night Ever, and sings as part of the choir for the At the Gala song. Later appears during Becoming Popular (The Pony Everypony Should Know) and at the Canterlot Garden Party in Sweet and Elite. He is included in the Valentine's Day Card Creator with the designation "MLP_CharV_Stallion"—a Card Creator screenshot posted by the official European Spanish My Little Pony Facebook page pairs him with Rarity—and also appears in the footer background of a former Hub web page on Promotions.com for Castle Creator. Shares his eye color and sometimes design with Blue Moon, "South Pole", and "Star Dream / Sky Dream", and shares his cutie mark with "Persnickety". His cutie mark is a compass rose that resembles a sun.

characters.name: Chocolate Tail
characters.description: Appears in The Ticket Master during Rarity's fantasy about the gala. His cutie mark is a golden laurel wreath.

characters.name: Cinnabelle
characters.description: A pony who first appears in Family Appreciation Day during Granny Smith's sepia memory and who later appears in Make New Friends but Keep Discord during the present-day Grand Galloping Gala. Appears in flashback again in No Second Prances. Resembles "Dosie Dough".

characters.name: Cipher Splash
characters.description: Jumps on the rooftops during the Smile Song as well as a later scene in A Friend in Deed. Her design is the same as that of Twinkleshine, Lemon Hearts, and Apple Stars, and her color scheme is similar to those of "Pixie" and "Fly Wishes". She is named on her Enterplay collectible card game Canterlot Nights expansion set card #10 U, which gives her the description "Nopony in Equestria has figured out what Cipher Splash's cutie mark is supposed to be. She kind of likes it that way."

characters.name: Citrine Spark
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The Hearth's Warming Club, Friendship University, The End in Friend, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, Sparkle's Seven, She's All Yak, Student Counsel, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, Daring Doubt, The Ending of the End - Part 2, Teacher of the Month, Starlight the Hypnotist, the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 102 comic Underwater memories, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Her cutie mark is a red and light-yellow starburst. She is a character called "Chatty Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her bio states, "As her textbooks say, talking is the first step to making friends! ...Unless you're a mime." Voiced by Andrea Libman in Marks for Effort and Kelly Sheridan in School Raze.

characters.name:
Fashionable Pony
Citrus Blush
characters.description: See Canterlot Trendsetters.

characters.name: Cloverbelle
characters.description: Appears at the Crystal Empire in Equestria Games, between S04E24 Unnamed Pegasus Mare #1 and Pegasus Emerald Green, in Our Town in The Cutie Map - Part 2, at the School for Gifted Unicorns in The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1, in Parental Glideance, in The End in Friend, in Yakity-Sax, in The Washouts, in 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, and in The Summer Sun Setback. Shares her design with Twinkleshine, Lemon Hearts, Apple Stars, S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, and S04E24 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #3. Her cutie mark is a four-leaf clover. Appeared​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ in fanart years before appearing on the show.

characters.name: Cold Front
characters.description: Appears twice in one audience in Sisterhooves Social and Brotherhooves Social. Shares the same design and mane as Amethyst Star and the same coat, eyes, and thunderstorm cutie mark as White Lightning.

characters.name: Comet Tail
characters.description: See Comet Tail.

characters.name: Coral Bits
characters.description: Appears in Spice Up Your Life as a patron of the Tasty Treat restaurant. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus. Her cutie mark is two crossed knives. Her appearance is based on celebrity chef Cat Cora.

characters.name:
Line Pony
Cranberry Muffin
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin, The Point of No Return, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Has a speaking role in Grannies Gone Wild. Voiced by Kelly Sheridan.

characters.name: Crimson Heart
characters.description: Appears in Buckball Season trying out for the Ponyville buckball team. Shares his design with "Spellbound" and S08E14 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #3. His cutie mark is three red hearts. Voiced by Richard Ian Cox.

characters.name: Crystal Clear
characters.description: One of the judges at Twilight Sparkle's School for Gifted Unicorns entrance exam in The Cutie Mark Chronicles. Later appears in Equestria Games and The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1. Also appears in the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #8 page 5, and Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 3. She wears a watch. Her cutie mark is three brilliant-cut gemstones. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name:
Wedding Guest Pony
Dark Moon
characters.description: See Dark Moon.

characters.name: Dear Darling
characters.description: Appears in Hard to Say Anything as one of three ponies swooning over Feather Bangs. Her cutie mark is a carrot, tomato, and peas. She is a character called "Swoony Fanfilly" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "This pony TRIED to talk to Feather Bangs this one time, but then she hyperventilated so much that she fainted. It was still worth it."

characters.name: Diamond Mint
characters.description: See Diamond Mint.

characters.name: Distant Star
characters.description: Appears in Amending Fences watering plants. Also appears in The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1, On Your Marks, Where the Apple Lies, Parental Glideance, and The Washouts. Her cutie mark is three blue stars.

characters.name: DJ Pon-3
characters.description: See DJ Pon-3.

characters.name: Dr Steth
characters.description: Appears in On Your Marks as Mr. Waddle's doctor, in Where the Apple Lies, and in A Flurry of Emotions. His cutie mark is a stethoscope.

characters.name:
Distinguished Waiter Pony
Earl Grey
characters.description: A waiter who serves Rarity coffee at the beginning of Sweet and Elite, snacks during the song, and snacks again at the garden party. Also appears in several of the tiles during the Becoming Popular (The Pony Everypony Should Know) song and in The Last Problem. He is a character named "Distinguished Waiter Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Royal Dining: First Course" event. His in-game bio states "He's been in catering for a decade or two now--and he's got the poise and fancy accent to prove it." His cutie mark is a pink tea cup. A similar pony appears in the manga.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Electric Sky
characters.description: See Electric Sky.

characters.name: Eliza
characters.description: A pony in Granny Smith's sepia memories in Family Appreciation Day and Leap of Faith.

characters.name: Fat Stacks
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, The Last Problem, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. His cutie mark is two bundles of U.S. dollars.

characters.name: Fiery Fricket
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Forgotten Friendship, Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is a ring of blue fire.

characters.name: Fine Catch
characters.description: Appears in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place as a student at the School of Friendship. His cutie mark is a steamboat and fish.

characters.name: Fine Line
characters.description: See Fine Line.

characters.name: Flank Sinatra
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Dark Moon. He is less tinted by the lighting in two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page (one and two) than in the image to the right.

characters.name: Fly Wishes
characters.description: Opens a window and joins the chorus of Smile Song in A Friend in Deed. Her design is the same as that of Amethyst Star, Lyra Heartstrings, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem, and her color scheme is similar to those of "Pixie" and Cipher Splash.

characters.name: Four Step
characters.description: See Four Step.

characters.name: Foxxy Trot
characters.description: One of Sapphire Shores' backup dancers in For Whom the Sweetie Belle Toils. Also appears in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #37, and in a photograph in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1.

characters.name: Fresh Coat
characters.description: Appears in Spice Up Your Life as a painter pony. Her cutie mark is a can of white paint.

characters.name: Fuchsia Fizz
characters.description: Seen in Friendship is Magic, part 1, Applebuck Season, Boast Busters, Winter Wrap Up, The Show Stoppers, The Mysterious Mare Do Well, The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, A Friend in Deed, Magic Duel, Simple Ways, Filli Vanilli, It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, Leap of Faith, Trade Ya!, Honest Apple, and the outro of the Adventures in Ponyville online game, always from behind while facing forward except for two shots during The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000. She shares her design with Minuette, Sea Swirl, Peachy Pitt, Silver Spanner from the front, "The Inquisitor", "Perfect Timing", S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #2, S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, "Red Rose", S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, "Sunset Rain", "Passionate", S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, and Issue 08 Unnamed Mare - Hourglass, and shares her coat and mane colors with Cheerilee and Cherry Blossom.

characters.name: Gary Coronet
characters.description: Appears in Equestria Games. Shares his design with Doctor Horse, S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #2, S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #2, and "Black Marble", and resembles "Ponet". Only a small portion of his cutie mark is shown.

characters.name: Ginger Shade
characters.description: Appears in Spice Up Your Life as a painter pony. Shares his design with "Package Deal". His cutie mark is a paint roller.

characters.name: Giza Hafir
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done? as a resident of Somnambula. Also appears in Road to Friendship and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place.

characters.name:
Trendy Choreographer
Glamour Trot
characters.description: Appears in Hard to Say Anything as one of Feather Bangs' backup dancers during Battle for Sugar Belle. His cutie mark is a horseshoe and yellow star. He is a character called "Trendy Choreographer" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Gold Slipper
characters.description: A guest at the Grand Galloping Gala in The Best Night Ever. Shares her color scheme and dress color scheme with fellow Gala guest "Masquerade". Has the same design and dress design as "Charm" and S04E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is the same as that of Shoeshine, Lilac Links, Sunny Smiles, and Eclair Crème, a pair of interlocking horseshoes, one gold and one silver.

characters.name: Golden Gavel
characters.description: See Fancy Pants' entourage.

characters.name:
Head Chef Pony
Gourmand Ramsay
characters.description: Appears in Spice Up Your Life as a patron of the Tasty Treat restaurant, in Viva Las Pegasus, in Grannies Gone Wild, in Growing Up is Hard to Do, in The Last Problem, and—earlier—in the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #8 pages 1, 6, and 9 as an short-tempered chef or supervisor at the School for Gifted Unicorns Royal High Tea. His appearance is based on chef and TV personality Gordon Ramsay. He is a character named "Head Chef Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss in the "Royal Dining: Entrée" and "The Pinkie Parents Problem" events. His in-game description states "Host of the popular documentary film series 'Kitchen of Tartarus,' and an EXTREMELY loud yeller." His cutie mark is a flame in the show and a pair of kitchen knives in the comic.

characters.name: Heather Harp
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with Lyra Heartstrings, shares her design and eye color with "Monochrome Sunset", and shares her design with Amethyst Star, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem. Her cutie mark is a lyre.

characters.name: High Roller
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, The Last Problem, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Shares his color scheme nearly with S07E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #7 and "End Zone". His cutie mark appears to be a dice cup with two dice.

characters.name:
Masked Pony 1
Hippocratic Oath
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a doctor/surgeon at the Ponyville Hospital. Voiced by Brian Drummond.

characters.name: Holly Dash
characters.description: See Holly Dash.

characters.name: Hors D'oeuvre
characters.description: Appears in Applejack's flashback in The Cutie Mark Chronicles. Later appears in Trade Ya! Shares his mane style and eye color with Savoir Fare. His cutie mark is a covered silver serving-dish.

characters.name:
Duchess of Maretonia
Ice Mirror
characters.description: Appears with "Kyrippos II" in Equestria Games and Twilight's Kingdom - Part 1 and its recap at the beginning of Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2 and on the season 4 poster.

characters.name: Infinity
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! Shares his mane style, eye color, cutie mark, and accessory design with Perfect Pace, shares his mane style, eye color, and accessory design with "Emerald Beacon", and shares his color scheme with "Beyond". His cutie mark is an hourglass. Resembles the character Robert Lutece from the video game BioShock Infinite.

characters.name: The Inquisitor
characters.description: Appears in Winter Wrap Up on the Plant Team. Shares her design and cutie mark with Minuette, "Perfect Timing", S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, "Red Rose", and Issue 08 Unnamed Mare - Hourglass, and shares her design with Sea Swirl, Peachy Pitt, Silver Spanner from the front, "Fuchsia Fizz", S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #2, S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, "Sunset Rain", "Passionate", and S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4. Her cutie mark is an hourglass.

characters.name:
Wide-Eyed Villager
Ivy Vine
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, To Where and Back Again - Part 1, To Where and Back Again - Part 2, Rock Solid Friendship, and Hard to Say Anything. Shares her mane and tail style with S04E24 Unnamed Earth Mare #1 and "Soft Spot" and her tail style and sometimes mane style with Daisy, and resembles Snowdrop. Her cutie mark is three leaves. She is a character called "Wide-Eyed Villager" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her in-game description states, "Is she surprised? Does she have something in her eyes? Or is she just looking at something far away? It's hard to say with this pony, but hopefully she'll give those lids a rest soon."

characters.name: Juno
characters.description: See Sailor Moon ponies.

characters.name: Lemon Hearts
characters.description: See Lemon Hearts.

characters.name: Lemon Honey
characters.description: A bookseller who attends Moon Dancer's party in Amending Fences. Also appears in The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1, Spice Up Your Life, and Parental Glideance. Her cutie mark is a beehive. She resembles Honey Lemon from the Disney film Big Hero 6.

characters.name: Lemony Gem
characters.description: See Lemony Gem.

characters.name: Lilac Hearts
characters.description: Appears with her eyes closed during the pageant performance in Hearth's Warming Eve, following Princess Platinum into the summit of the tribes. She shares her design and eye color with Lemon Hearts and Apple Stars, shares her design with Twinkleshine, and shares her mane and tail style and eye color with "Golden Glory". She is named with a trademark symbol in the eleventh wave of mystery pack toys and collector cards, which shows her eye color and states that she "loves acting in plays!"

characters.name: Lilac Notes
characters.description: Appears at Rainbow Falls in Trade Ya! and is appearing in My Little Pony The Movie. Shares her design with Lyra Heartstrings, Amethyst Star, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem, and resembles "Ballad". Her cutie mark is a white G-clef in Trade Ya!

characters.name: Lilly Love
characters.description: Appears in Canterlot Boutique as a patron of Canterlot Carousel, in Spice Up Your Life, in Viva Las Pegasus, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is two hearts, one with a pin in it.

characters.name: Lipstick Vanity
characters.description: Appears in Buckball Season trying out for the Ponyville buckball team. Her cutie mark is a white flowerbud. Shares her design and eye color with "Burning Heart" and S09E17 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1.

characters.name: Log Jam
characters.description: Appears, sometimes cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1, The Cutie Map - Part 2, To Where and Back Again - Part 1, and To Where and Back Again - Part 2. Shares his mane and tail style and partly color scheme with Noteworthy, his mane and tail style with Goldengrape, and his cutie unmarked color scheme with S06E25 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1. His cutie mark is a log with a hand saw.

characters.name: Lolli Love
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a nurse pony at the Ponyville Hospital. Her cutie mark is a heart-shaped lollipop.

characters.name: Love Melody
characters.description: See Sailor Moon ponies.

characters.name:
Stylish Fan
Love Sketch
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Once Upon a Zeppelin, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever as an Earth pony, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is two hearts and a heart outline. She is a character called "Stylish Fan" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Lyra Heartstrings
characters.description: See Lyra Heartstrings.

characters.name: Magnet Bolt
characters.description: See Magnet Bolt.

characters.name: Maple Cheer
characters.description: Appears, cutie unmarked, in The Cutie Map - Part 1 and The Cutie Map - Part 2.

characters.name:
Timekeeper Pony
Medallion Gold
characters.description: The timekeeping pony for the Equestria Games qualification tryouts in Rainbow Falls. Also appears in Rarity's flashback in The Cart Before the Ponies and at the Ponyville Hospital in Where the Apple Lies. His cutie mark is a gold medal with a red lanyard. Voiced by Jayson Thiessen. He is a character called "Timekeeper Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. His in-game description states, "This pony always had a passion for telling time at sporting events...and now he does it for a living! Dreams really do come true."

characters.name: Midwinter Grace
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Royal Ribbon. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show her more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Mint Condition
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction as an attendee of the Daring Do Convention and in Parental Glideance. Shares his body style and eye color with Claude, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #21, Stinky Bottom, "Leadnail McColt", S06E03 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, "Port Wine", Coriander Cumin, and Cattail. His cutie mark is a peppermint candy.

characters.name:
Pony Shopper
Minty Bubblegum
characters.description: Appears in On Your Marks chewing bubblegum. Also appears in A Rockhoof and a Hard Place and My Little Pony Best Gift Ever. Her cutie mark is a gumball machine. Voiced by Andrea Libman in Best Gift Ever. [1]​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Minuette
characters.description: See Minuette.

characters.name: Miss Hackney
characters.description: Appears in a flashback as one of Twilight Sparkle's teachers in Amending Fences. Also appears in present day in The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1, Spice Up Your Life, Viva Las Pegasus, Parental Glideance, A Royal Problem, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is an apple and ruler.

characters.name: Monochrome Sunset
characters.description: Appears twice at once during Life in Equestria in Magical Mystery Cure, on opposite sides of the crowd at the beginning of the song and in the crowd later on. Has the same design and eye color as Lyra Heartstrings and "Heather Harp" and the same design as Amethyst Star, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem.

characters.name:
Goth Pony
Moonlight Raven
characters.description: See Sunshine Smiles and Moonlight Raven.

characters.name: Mossy Rock
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin, Grannies Gone Wild, The Point of No Return, Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8, and Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique episode 1. Not based on Christian "Chris-Chan" Chandler.

characters.name: Mulberry Flowers
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Grannies Gone Wild, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The End in Friend, The Washouts, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with S08E09 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, her mane and tail style with "Moonlight Raven", and her eyes nearly with Twilight Sparkle. Her cutie mark is a bunch of purple flowers.

characters.name: Nachtmusik
characters.description: Appears in Ponyville's shared dream in Do Princesses Dream of Magic Sheep? She shares her design with Lyra Heartstrings.

characters.name: Morning Roast
characters.description: Moon Dancer's sister. Attends her party in Amending Fences. Also appears in The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1, Parental Glideance, Yakity-Sax, and The Washouts. Her cutie mark is a coffee mug.

characters.name:
Detective Pony
Natural Deduction
characters.description: Appears in Canterlot in Rarity Investigates! and in A Hearth's Warming Tail. Has the same body type as Trenderhoof, "Free Throw", "Uptown Clover", "Mustafa Combe", and S06E17 Unnamed Earth Stallion #6 and a similar body type to "Sprig Hooffield", S07E10 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, and Chancellor Neighsay. Resembles Sherlock Holmes as portrayed by Benedict Cumberbatch. His cutie mark is a bumblebee. He is a character called "Detective Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Neon Lights
characters.description: See Neon Lights.

characters.name:
Smiley Somnambulan
Nile Faras
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done? as a resident of Somnambula. Also appears in Shadow Play - Part 1, Road to Friendship, and A Rockhoof and a Hard Place. Shares her body design with S08E21 Unnamed Earth Mare #1. She is a character named "Smiley Somnambulan" in Gameloft's mobile game. Her bio states, "This pony may not always agree with visitors to her town--but she makes sure to show them a friendly face anyways."

characters.name: Nixie
characters.description: Appears in Bridle Gossip, largely obscured. Her design is the same as that of Trixie, "Pixie", and "Blossom Delight".

characters.name: Nook
characters.description: Appears during The Super Duper Party Pony in Pinkie Pride. Shares her design, eye color, and cutie mark with S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, her design and eye color with Twinkleshine and S05E02 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and her design with Lemon Hearts and Apple Stars. Her cutie mark is a green leaf.

characters.name:
Architecture Pony
North Point
characters.description: See Canterlot Trendsetters.

characters.name:
Perceptive Friendship Student
November Rain
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The Hearth's Warming Club, Friendship University, The End in Friend, Road to Friendship, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, What Lies Beneath, School Raze - Part 1, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, She's All Yak, Student Counsel, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, A Trivial Pursuit, The Summer Sun Setback, A Horse Shoe-In, Daring Doubt, The Ending of the End - Part 2, Teacher of the Month, Starlight the Hypnotist, the Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 102 comic Underwater memories, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares his body design with S09E05 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1. He is a character called "Perceptive Friendship Student" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as an enemy minion during the She's All Yak event. His bio states, "This studious stallion knows when something's rotten on campus - and will try his best to make it right." His cutie mark is a raincloud.

characters.name: Ocean Breeze
characters.description: Appears once in one audience in Sisterhooves Social and Brotherhooves Social. Shares the same design and mane as Lemon Hearts and the same coat, eyes, and rain cutie mark as Sprinkle Medley.

characters.name:
Jeweled Pony
Old Money
characters.description: Appears in Fake It 'Til You Make It as a customer at Rarity For You. Shares her body design with Prim Hemline, Stormy Flare, "Greenhoof Hooffield", "Betsey Trotson", "Clarity Cut", "Candy Curls", S07E20 Unnamed Earth Mare #1, Professor Fossil, S09E19 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is a sparkling pearl ring. Enterplay collectible card game Friends Forever #78 R names her—after old money—and quotes, "Every benefit auction I oversee must be run just so." Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name:
Masked Nurse
Open Heart
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a doctor/surgeon at the Ponyville Hospital. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Orchid Dew
characters.description: Appears during the Running of the Leaves with the number "00" in Fall Weather Friends, in Lesson Zero, during Apple Bloom's imagined future Ponyville in Hearts and Hooves Day, in Pinkie Pride, in Bloom & Gloom, and in Yakity-Sax. Shares the same design as Diamond Mint.

characters.name:
Delivery Pony
Package Deal
characters.description: A delivery pony who makes a delivery at Canterlot Carousel in Rarity Investigates! Also appears in Crusaders of the Lost Mark and Daring Done? Shares his design with "Ginger Shade". Like M2 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, he is referred to as "Delivery Pony" in the end credits and voiced by Brian Drummond. He is a character called "Contractor Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Passionate
characters.description: Appears in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. Shares her design with Minuette, Sea Swirl, Peachy Pitt, Silver Spanner from the front, "Fuchsia Fizz", "The Inquisitor", "Perfect Timing", S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #2, S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, "Red Rose", S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, "Sunset Rain", S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, and Issue 08 Unnamed Mare - Hourglass.

characters.name:
Mistmane's Mother
Peaceful Flower
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as Mistmane's mother in Rarity's story. Her cutie mark is a pink and yellow lotus. She is a character called "Mistmane's Mother" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Banner Vendor
Peachy Pitt
characters.description: See Peachy Pitt.

characters.name: Peanut Pastry
characters.description: Appears in Canterlot Boutique as a patron of Canterlot Carousel. Also appears in The Point of No Return. Her cutie mark is two acorns.

characters.name: Peanut Plant
characters.description: Appears in Stranger Than Fan Fiction managing a booth at the Daring Do Convention. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Once Upon a Zeppelin, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. His cutie mark is a peanut and leaf.

characters.name: Perfect Timing
characters.description: Sings in Winter Wrap Up. Shares her design and cutie mark with Minuette, "The Inquisitor", S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, "Red Rose", and Issue 08 Unnamed Mare - Hourglass, and shares her design with Sea Swirl, Peachy Pitt, Silver Spanner from the front, "Fuchsia Fizz", S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #2, S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, "Sunset Rain", "Passionate", and S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4. Her cutie mark is an hourglass.

characters.name: Pinny Lane
characters.description: See Bowler Ponies.

characters.name: Pixie
characters.description: Appears in Bridle Gossip and The Return of Harmony Part 1. Her design is the same as that of Trixie, "Nixie", and "Blossom Delight", and her color scheme is similar to those of Cipher Splash and "Fly Wishes".

characters.name:
Student 1
Polo Play
characters.description: One of four polo-playing ponies in Princess Spike. Also appears at the Canterlot Carousel grand opening in Canterlot Boutique, at the School for Gifted Unicorns in The Cutie Re-Mark - Part 1, at the Tasty Treat restaurant in Spice Up Your Life, at Gladmane's resort in Viva Las Pegasus, at the Wonderbolts showcase in Parental Glideance, with a speaking role in Friendship University, in Yakity-Sax, in The Washouts, in The Point of No Return, in The Ending of the End - Part 1, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Shares his design with S08E14 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #2. His cutie mark usually is a polo helmet and rarely is a polo helmet and stars. Voiced by Riley Murdock.

characters.name:
Elite Pony
Ponet
characters.description: See Ponet.

characters.name: Poppycock
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as "Ponet", and resembles Floribunda. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show him more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name:
Snobbish Waiter Pony
Port Wine
characters.description: Appears in The Gift of the Maud Pie as a waiter at the Cantering Cook restaurant. Also appears in The Last Problem. Shares his body type with Claude, S05E06 Unnamed Earth Stallion #21, Stinky Bottom, "Leadnail McColt", S06E03 Unnamed Earth Stallion #4, Coriander Cumin, "Mint Condition", and Cattail. He is a character named "Snobbish Waiter Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Royal Dining: First Course" event. His in-game description states "No, you cannot have grated cheese on your coronation rigatoni, because it would RUIN the FLAVOR PROFILE." His cutie mark is a block of cheese and a bunch of grapes.

characters.name: Precious
characters.description: Sings in Winter Wrap Up. Has same design as Lemon Hearts.

characters.name: Press Release
characters.description: See Paparazzi ponies.

characters.name:
Nasal Pony
Pretzel
characters.description: Appears in Canterlot Boutique as a patron of Canterlot Carousel, in Spice Up Your Life as a patron of the Tasty Treat restaurant, in Viva Las Pegasus, in The Point of No Return, in The Ending of the End - Part 1, and in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is a pretzel. A translucent Playful Ponies toy of her was shown at the 2016 New York Toy Fair. Voiced by Cathy Weseluck in Canterlot Boutique and Tabitha St. Germain in The Point of No Return.

characters.name: Primrose​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​
characters.description: Proud guest at the Grand Galloping Gala in The Best Night Ever, appears again in Sweet and Elite, appears with a speaking role in Princess Twilight Sparkle - Part 1, appears in Maretropolis in Power Ponies, and appears hornless at the Grand Galloping Gala in Make New Friends but Keep Discord. Also appears in the middle background of a former Hub web page on Promotions.com for Castle Creator. Shares the same coat and mane colors as Aunt Orange. She wears the same dress as Four Step.

characters.name:
Slick Waiter Pony
Pristine
characters.description: A waiter who serves Rarity snacks in Sweet and Elite and also appears in several of the tiles during the Becoming Popular (The Pony Everypony Should Know) song. He also appears briefly in Canterlot Boutique during Rules of Rarity, in Celestial Advice, and in The Last Problem. Resembles S04E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #3. He is a character named "Slick Waiter Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Royal Dining: Entrée" event. His in-game description states "How many cider flutres full of applesauce can he carry at once? We bet it's a whole bunch." His cutie mark is a pepper mill.

characters.name: Puppydog Tails
characters.description: Appears in The Cart Before the Ponies participating in the Applewood Derby alongside Snips. His cutie mark is a barber's pole.

characters.name: Purple Stuff
characters.description: Appears throughout crowds in A Canterlot Wedding - Part 2 and Magical Mystery Cure. Has the same design as Dark Moon. Two promotional images from The Hub's Facebook page show him more clearly than the corresponding frames of the show do.

characters.name: Quiet Gestures
characters.description: Appears as a mime in Princess Spike. Her cutie mark is three blocks.

characters.name: Rachel Hay
characters.description: Appears in Spice Up Your Life as a patron of the Tasty Treat restaurant. Also appears in The Maud Couple and Growing Up is Hard to Do. Her appearance is based on American television chef Rachael Ray.

characters.name:
Mistmane's Father
Rain Swirl
characters.description: Appears in Campfire Tales as Mistmane's father in Rarity's story. His cutie mark is a raincloud. He is a character called "Mistmane's Father" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Rainbow Stars
characters.description: See Rainbow Stars.

characters.name: Ramal Kthyb
characters.description: Appears in Road to Friendship at the Get On Inn. Shares her design with S07E16 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #2.

characters.name: Rare Find
characters.description: See Rare Find.

characters.name:
Bookstore Pony 1
Raspberry Latte
characters.description: Appears in The Parent Map as a resident and bookstore owner in Sire's Hollow. Her cutie mark is a coffee cup. She is a character called "Historical Bookshop Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game. Voiced by Dolores Drake.

characters.name:
Cruise Pony 1
Raspberry Sorbet
characters.description: Appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin as a passenger on Iron Will's Cruise of the Princesses Experience. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild, Marks for Effort, Yakity-Sax, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, and Between Dark and Dawn. Shares her color scheme with S08E01 Unnamed Earth Filly #1. Her cutie mark is a boiled egg. Voiced by Tabitha St. Germain.

characters.name: Red Rose
characters.description: Appears in the audience of Rarity's fashion show in Suited For Success. Shares her design and cutie mark with Minuette, "The Inquisitor", "Perfect Timing", S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, and Issue 08 Unnamed Mare - Hourglass, and shares her design with Sea Swirl, Peachy Pitt, Silver Spanner from the front, "Fuchsia Fizz", S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #2, S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, "Sunset Rain", "Passionate", and S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4. Her cutie mark is an hourglass.

characters.name: Rhythm / Night Shade
characters.description: Appears in Friendship is Magic, part 2, in Applejack's fantasy in The Ticket Master, in Winter Wrap Up, in the audience of the first fashion show in Suited For Success, in the audience of the talent show in The Show Stoppers, in the audience in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, in Pinkie Pride, with a visible cutie mark in Simple Ways, in Filli Vanilli, with a visible cutie mark varying between a web and a tornado in It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, in Trade Ya!, and in Saved by My Friends. Shares the same color palette with Noteworthy.

characters.name:
Trainer 1
Roar Horn
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus as one of two exotic animal trainers in Ponet Fantastique. His cutie mark is a white tiger. Shares his body design with "Stärke Kragen", Chancellor Puddinghead, and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Bears a resemblance to either Siegfried Fischbacher or Roy Horn. Voiced by Brian Drummond.

characters.name: Rosewood Brook
characters.description: A pony in Granny Smith's sepia memory montage in Family Appreciation Day. Possibly Lemon Hearts' character model.

characters.name:
Trim EEA Official
Rosy Pearl
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Forgotten Friendship, School Daze - Part 1, Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, The Last Problem, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is a crystal rose and three pink hearts. She is a character called "Trim EEA Official" in Gameloft's mobile game, and she serves as an enemy minion during the School Raze-based event. Her in-game description states, "This astute academic has spent YEARS studying how to get her mane to go like that. But...you know...with magic, not with conditioner."

characters.name:
Dapper Pony
Rotten Apple
characters.description: Appears in Canterlot in Rarity Investigates! and in A Hearth's Warming Tail. Resembles James Moriarty as portrayed by Andrew Scott. His cutie mark is an apple with a bite taken out of it. He is a character called "Dapper Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Royal Pin
characters.description: See Royal Pin.

characters.name: Royal Ribbon
characters.description: See Royal Ribbon.

characters.name: Say Cheese
characters.description: A camerapony at the Canterlot Carousel grand opening in Canterlot Boutique. Also appears in The Point of No Return,, The Summer Sun Setback, and The Last Problem. Her cutie mark is a heart-shaped block of cheese.

characters.name: Sea Spray​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​
characters.description: Appears in Magic Duel and A Royal Problem. Has the same design as Amethyst Star and Lyra Heartstrings and the same color scheme as Helia. Her cutie mark is a cupcake.

characters.name: Sea Swirl
characters.description: See Sea Swirl.

characters.name: Shrimp Cuisine
characters.description: Appears in Spice Up Your Life as a patron of the Tasty Treat restaurant. Also appears in Grannies Gone Wild. His appearance is based on British celebrity chef Jamie Oliver.

characters.name: Silver Spanner
characters.description: See Silver Spanner.

characters.name: Slapshot
characters.description: Appears in Buckball Season as the unicorn goalie on the Appleloosa buckball team. Also appears in The End in Friend. Has a similar body type and color scheme to "Crosscut McColt" and "Hacksaw McColt".

characters.name: Smiley Star
characters.description: Appears in Where the Apple Lies as a patient with a broken horn at the Ponyville Hospital. His cutie mark appears to be a smiling-faced yellow star.

characters.name:
Trendy Photographer Pony
Snapshot
characters.description: A camerapony at the Canterlot Carousel grand opening in Canterlot Boutique. Also appears in Forever Filly, Parental Glideance, A Royal Problem, and The Point of No Return. His cutie mark is two photographs. He is a character called "Trendy Photographer Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: South Pole
characters.description: Appears outside the Grand Galloping Gala at Canterlot in The Best Night Ever, and sings as part of the choir for the At the Gala song. Also appears as a movie star in the Ruckus Reader interactive storybook Rarity Loves Fashion, which states that Rarity has made clothes for him. Shares his design, mane and eye colors, vest design and partly or completely color scheme, and sometimes cutie mark with Blue Moon, shares his eye color and sometimes design with "Chocolate Sun" and "Star Dream / Sky Dream", and shares his cutie mark with Léon, usually Prince Blueblood, and in some material Friends Forever 13 Unnamed Stallion - Doctor. His cutie mark is a compass rose.

characters.name: Spellbound
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Forgotten Friendship, School Daze - Part 1, Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Shares his design with "Crimson Heart" and S08E14 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #3. His cutie mark is a magician's cap.

characters.name:
Trainer 2
Sprigfield
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus as one of two exotic animal trainers in Ponet Fantastique. Shares his eyes with "Stärke Kragen" and partly Chancellor Puddinghead. Bears a resemblance to either Siegfried Fischbacher or Roy Horn. Voiced by Peter Kelamis.

characters.name: Spring Fresh
characters.description: Guest at the Grand Galloping Gala in The Best Night Ever. Also appears in the storybook Rainbow Dash and the Treasure Hunt. A similar pony appears on the IDW comics' Micro-Series Issue #2 page 1. Shares same design with Amethyst Star, Diamond Mint, and Lemony Gem, and resembles S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4.

characters.name: Sprout Greenhoof
characters.description: Appears in Viva Las Pegasus at Gladmane's Las Pegasus resort. Also appears in Forgotten Friendship, Grannies Gone Wild, Friendship University, Common Ground, Between Dark and Dawn, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, Daring Doubt, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Shares her design with S09E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1. Her cutie mark is a potted plant.

characters.name: Stage Tales
characters.description: Appears in School Daze - Part 1, School Daze - Part 2, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Grannies Gone Wild, The Parent Map, Non-Compete Clause, Molt Down, Marks for Effort, A Matter of Principals, The End in Friend, A Rockhoof and a Hard Place, School Raze - Part 2, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Beginning of the End - Part 2, She's All Yak, 2, 4, 6, Greaaat, A Horse Shoe-In, Daring Doubt, The Ending of the End - Part 2, The Last Problem, and MLP8_Promo_Image_with_Copyright as a student at the School of Friendship. Shares his design with "Ponet", "Star Bright", "Poppycock", S02E26 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #4, and S06E25 Unnamed Unicorn Stallion #1, his mane and tail style with Royal Pin, "The Tenth Doctor / Doctor Whooves #3", Compass Star, Starry Eyes, "Sightseer", S06E08 Unnamed Pegasus Stallion #1, and S07E13 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, his tail style with Madden, "Star Gazer", Perfect Pace, "Raggedy Doctor", "Emerald Beacon", "Jeff Trotsworthy", S04E19 Unnamed Earth Stallion #1, and "Infinity", and his cutie mark with On Stage. His cutie mark is a pair of comedy/tragedy masks.

characters.name: Star Bright
characters.description: See Star Bright.

characters.name: Star Dream / Sky Dream
characters.description: Appears outside the Grand Galloping Gala at Canterlot in The Best Night Ever, and sings as part of the choir for the At the Gala song. Shares his design, eye color, sometimes cutie mark design and some of those times color scheme, and vest design and partly or completely color scheme with Blue Moon, shares his design, eye color, and vest design and partly color scheme with "South Pole", and shares his eye color and sometimes design with "Chocolate Sun". His cutie mark is three stars of varying coloration.

characters.name:
Dignified Shop-Pony
Stärke Kragen
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review and Fake It 'Til You Make It as a Rarity For You salespony. Shares his body design and eye color with Chancellor Puddinghead, his body design with "Roar Horn" and partly S08E01 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, and his eyes with "Sprigfield". Resembles fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld, the same basis as Hoity Toity. He is a character named "Dignified Shop-Pony" in Gameloft's mobile game, and acts as a helper during the "Fake It 'Til You Make It" boss battle event. His cutie mark is three fruits.

characters.name: Steeplechase
characters.description: One of four polo-playing ponies in Princess Spike. Also appears in Viva Las Pegasus, Grannies Gone Wild, Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8, and My Little Pony Established 1983 "Punk Rock Dash!" His cutie mark is a polo ball and two crossed polo mallets.

characters.name: Strawberry Lime
characters.description: Appears in the VIP section in The Best Night Ever. Later appears in Equestria Games. Shares same design with Royal Ribbon.

characters.name: Sugarberry
characters.description: Member of the weather team in Winter Wrap Up. Her cutie mark is three diamonds. Shares same design with Amethyst Star.

characters.name: Sunset Rain
characters.description: Appears in Twilight's Kingdom - Part 2. Shares her design with Minuette, Sea Swirl, Peachy Pitt, Silver Spanner from the front, "Fuchsia Fizz", "The Inquisitor", "Perfect Timing", S04E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #2, S04E22 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, "Red Rose", S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #1, "Passionate", S02E11 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #4, and Issue 08 Unnamed Mare - Hourglass.

characters.name: Sunshine Petals
characters.description: See Sunshine Petals.

characters.name:
Bright Pony
Sunshine Smiles
characters.description: See Sunshine Smiles and Moonlight Raven.

characters.name: Sunspot
characters.description: See Sunburst's family.

characters.name: Swan Song
characters.description: See Fancy Pants' entourage.

characters.name: Sweet Biscuit
characters.description: Appears in Canterlot Boutique as a patron of Canterlot Carousel. Has a speaking line in Spice Up Your Life. Also appears in Buckball Season, Viva Las Pegasus, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, The Point of No Return, The Summer Sun Setback, and Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 8. Her cutie mark is three cookies with one with a bite in it.

characters.name: Sweet Dreams
characters.description: Shares the same design as Royal Ribbon. Appears in The Best Night Ever.

characters.name: Sweet Service
characters.description: Appears in The Saddle Row Review as a waitress in a Manehattan diner. Her cutie mark is a slice of cake.

characters.name: Top Marks
characters.description: See Top Marks.

characters.name:
Pony Vendor 3
Top Notch
characters.description: A pony seen wearing different hats during Granny Smith's sepia flashbacks respectively in Family Appreciation Day and in Leap of Faith and during the present day in Trade Ya! and My Little Pony Best Gift Ever. Resembles Neon Lights in color scheme, cutie mark, pony kind, and sometimes mane style, and resembles "Sir Pony Moore" in color scheme, cutie mark, and sometimes pony kind. Voiced by Garry Chalk in Best Gift Ever.

characters.name: Tropical Dream
characters.description: Appears as one of the Grand Equestria Pony Summit delegates in Princess Spike. Also appears in A Royal Problem and My Little Pony Established 1983 "Punk Rock Dash!" Shares her build with Princess Luna, Fleur de Lis, Princess Cadance, the Headless Horse, the Mane-iac, Sassy Saddles, S06E20 Unnamed Earth Mare #8, S06E20 Unnamed Earth Mare #9, and S06E20 Unnamed Earth Mare #10, and resembles the non-siren forms of Adagio Dazzle. Her cutie mark is two palm trees and three stars. She has been included in the Gameloft mobile game's files.​[​dubious – discuss‍​]​ According to Rebecca Dart, she represents the Equestrian equivalent of California; see Califoalnia.

characters.name: Twinkleshine
characters.description: See Twinkleshine.

characters.name: Undertone
characters.description: Appears in The Mane Attraction as a special effects pony for Coloratura. Charmaine Verhagen designed him after Prince.

characters.name:
Songbird Serenade's Agent
Vinny
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as part of Songbird Serenade's entourage. Resembles John Travolta's character Vincent Vega in the film Pulp Fiction; see also "Prancent Pega". Named in Beyond Equestria: Pinkie Pie Steps Up. Also appears on My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 pages 17 and 19. He is a character called "Songbird Serenade's Agent" in Gameloft's mobile game; the game's description of him states, "While certainly thrilling, he doesn't come cheap -- as entourages go, he's the top of the heap!" His cutie mark is a milkshake. A Pegasus version with a different​[​specify​]​ cutie mark appears in the My Little Pony: The Movie Search & Find book.

characters.name:
Songbird Serenade's Bodyguard
Whinnyfield
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony The Movie as part of Songbird Serenade's entourage. Resembles Samuel L. Jackson's character Jules Winnfield in the film Pulp Fiction; see also "Mules Grassfield". Named in Beyond Equestria: Pinkie Pie Steps Up. Also appears on My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #5 pages 17 and 19. He is a character called "Songbird Serenade's Bodyguard" in Gameloft's mobile game; the game's description of him states, "This pony's strong-hearted -- and rather elastic, since bodyguards need to be skilled at gymnastics." His cutie mark is a wallet. A Pegasus version with a different​[​specify​]​ cutie mark appears in the My Little Pony: The Movie Search & Find book.

characters.name:
Incidental Pony
Whoa Nelly
characters.description: See Whoa Nelly.
